flawed_nl_solution:
In the first week, Jed has 20 + 6 = <<20+6=26>>26 cards.
In the second week, he has 26 + 6 = <<26+6=23>>23 cards.
But he is left with 23 - 2 = <<23-2=21>>21 cards on the 2nd week after giving 2 cards to his friend.
Then Jed has 21 + 6 = <<21+6=27>>27 cards on the 3rd week.
He has 27 + 6 = <<27+6=33>>33 cards on the 4th week.
After giving his friend 2 cards, he is then left with 33 - 2 = <<33-2=31>>31 cards on the 4th week.
#### 4

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 32, not 23. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
